tasks.task: Preparing and moving to a farm
subtasks: Researching and selecting a suitable farm to leave urban living
Packing and loading personal belongings and possessions into trucks
Transporting from Las Vegas to the countryside
Unloading goods at the new farm location
Assessing and preparing heavy farm equipment for transport
Loading large tractor or plough onto a trailer for moving
Driving the trailer with equipment safely over long distances
Unloading and setting up equipment at the new farm
Performing initial maintenance checks on relocated machinery
Inspecting exterior of storage buildings for repairs (e.g., paint chipping)
Patching or repainting damaged areas of storage structures
Protecting or covering equipment during transport or storage
Conversations about agricultural family history and father's retirement
Transitioning from farming traditions to current family dynamics

tasks.task: ** Relocating personal and agricultural supplies. Secondary tasks include handling heavy equipment (tractors, ploughs) and maintaining/repairing storage structures. The specific subtasks are: packing personal and equipment items, loading into motorhome or similar transport, transporting via a long drive to the new location, unloading heavy machinery at site, ensuring safe setup, and checking/responding to minor structural issues on storage buildings.

subtasks: Packing personal and farm items into a trailer
Transporting the trailer to a new location
Unloading heavy machinery (e.g., tractors) from the trailer at the farm
Checking exterior paint for chipping
Repainting damaged areas to protect stored equipment.
